questions.question_text: The great circle distance between point A (60°N, 010°E) and point B (60°N, 170°E) is approximately:
questions.explanation: At 60°N, the great circle distance between two meridians is half the distance at the equator. The difference in longitude is 160° (170°E - 010°E), so the distance is 160° × 60 × cos60° = 4,800 × 0.5 = 2,400 nm.

questions.question_text: The convergency of meridians on a Lambert conformal conic chart is equal to:
options: A. Chart convergency
B. Earth convergency
C. Conversion angle
D. Rhumb line track

questions.question_text: The maximum difference between a rhumb line and a great circle track on a Mercator chart occurs when:
options: A. The track is east-west near the equator
B. The track is north-south
C. The track is east-west in high latitudes
D. The track is at 45° to the meridians

questions.question_text: The VOR system is subject to line-of-sight restrictions. The theoretical maximum range is primarily limited by:
options: A. The power output of the ground station
B. The height of the receiving antenna
C. The curvature of the Earth
D. The sensitivity of the airborne receiver

questions.question_text: The primary advantage of an inertial navigation system (INS) is that it:
options: A. Requires no ground-based navigation aids
B. Is not affected by atmospheric conditions
C. Provides extremely accurate position information over long periods
D. Is not subject to any position errors

questions.question_text: The GPS system provides position information based on:
options: A. Triangulation from three satellites
B. Trilateration from four satellites
C. Bearing measurements from two satellites
D. Distance measurements from one satellite

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of RAIM (Receiver Autonomous Integrity Monitoring) in GPS is to:
options: A. Increase the accuracy of position fixes
B. Detect faulty satellite signals
C. Reduce the effects of selective availability
D. Provide vertical guidance

questions.question_text: The term 'ETOPS' stands for:
options: A. Extended Twin Operations
B. Extended-range Twin-engine Operational Performance Standards
C. Engine Time Operating System
D. Estimated Time of Position System

questions.question_text: The primary factor affecting the accuracy of a pressure altimeter is:
options: A. Temperature
B. Humidity
C. Wind speed
D. Aircraft weight

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the Machmeter is to indicate:
options: A. True airspeed
B. Calibrated airspeed
C. The ratio of true airspeed to the local speed of sound
D. The ratio of indicated airspeed to the local speed of sound

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the turn coordinator is to indicate:
options: A. Rate of turn and slip/skid
B. Angle of bank and rate of turn
C. Angle of bank and slip/skid
D. Rate of turn and yaw

questions.question_text: The primary function of the attitude indicator is to provide the pilot with information about the aircraft's:
options: A. Pitch and bank
B. Pitch and yaw
C. Bank and yaw
D. Pitch, bank, and yaw

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the horizontal situation indicator (HSI) is to provide the pilot with information about the aircraft's:
options: A. Position relative to a VOR radial
B. Ground track and distance to a VOR station
C. Heading and position relative to a VOR radial
D. Ground speed and time to a VOR station

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the radio magnetic indicator (RMI) is to provide the pilot with information about:
options: A. The aircraft's heading and magnetic bearing to a VOR or NDB
B. The aircraft's ground track and distance to a VOR or NDB
C. The aircraft's position relative to a VOR radial or NDB bearing
D. The aircraft's altitude and vertical speed

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the flight management system (FMS) is to:
options: A. Automate the navigation and performance management of the aircraft
B. Control the aircraft's flight controls
C. Monitor the aircraft's engines
D. Provide weather information to the flight crew

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the traffic alert and collision avoidance system (TCAS) is to:
options: A. Detect and display other aircraft equipped with transponders
B. Detect and display all aircraft in the vicinity
C. Detect and display only aircraft on a collision course
D. Detect and display only aircraft at the same altitude

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the ground proximity warning system (GPWS) is to provide the flight crew with:
options: A. Warning of controlled flight into terrain (CFIT)
B. Warning of wind shear
C. Warning of traffic conflicts
D. Warning of system failures

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the weather radar is to detect:
options: A. Precipitation
B. Turbulence
C. Icing conditions
D. Wind shear

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the radio altimeter is to provide the flight crew with information about the aircraft's:
options: A. Height above the terrain directly below the aircraft
B. Height above sea level
C. Height above the airport elevation
D. Height above the runway threshold

questions.question_text: The primary purpose of the angle of attack (AOA) indicator is to provide the pilot with information about the aircraft's:
options: A. Angle between the wing chord line and the relative wind
B. Angle between the longitudinal axis and the horizon
C. Angle between the flight path and the horizon
D. Angle between the wing and the fuselage
